chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
R: stack nat
P: stack nat

Goal:
sym (P ++ R) = sym P ++ sym R

Premises:
stack = fun X : Type => list (card X) : Type -> Type Arguments stack _%type_scope
sym = fix sym R : list nat := match R with | [] => [] | (x, y) :: R0 => x ++ y ++ sym R0 end : stack nat -> list nat
MPCP = fun '(x, y, P) => exists A, A <<= (x, y) :: P /\ x ++ tau1 A = y ++ tau2 A : card nat * stack nat -> Prop
tau1_app : forall A B : stack ?X, tau1 (A ++ B) = tau1 A ++ tau1 B where ?X : [P : stack nat R : stack nat |- Type]
tau2_app : forall A B : stack ?X, tau2 (A ++ B) = tau2 A ++ tau2 B where ?X : [P : stack nat R : stack nat |- Type]
itau1_app : forall A B : list nat, itau1 ?P (A ++ B) = itau1 ?P A ++ itau1 ?P B where ?X : [P : stack nat R : stack nat |- Type] ?P : [P : stack nat R : stack nat |- stack ?X]
itau2_app : forall A B : list nat, itau2 ?P (A ++ B) = itau2 ?P A ++ itau2 ?P B where ?X : [P : stack nat R : stack nat |- Type] ?P : [P : stack nat R : stack nat |- stack ?X]
itau2 = fix itau2 (X : Type) (P : stack X) (A : list nat) {struct A} : string X := match A with | [] => [] | i :: A0 => snd (nth i P ([], [])) ++ itau2 X P A0 end : forall X : Type, stack X -> list nat -> string X Arguments itau2 {X}%type_scope _ _%list_scope
itau1 = fix itau1 (X : Type) (P : stack X) (A : list nat) {struct A} : string X := match A with | [] => [] | i :: A0 => fst (nth i P ([], [])) ++ itau1 X P A0 end : forall X : Type, stack X -> list nat -> string X Arguments itau1 {X}%type_scope _ _%list_scope
MPCPb = fun '(x, y, P) => exists A : stack bool, A <<= (x, y) :: P /\ x ++ tau1 A = y ++ tau2 A : card bool * stack bool -> Prop
cBPCP : forall (P : stack bool) (u : string bool), derivable P u u -> BPCP P
dPCP = fun (X : Type) (P : stack X) => exists u : string X, derivable P u u : forall X : Type, stack X -> Prop Arguments dPCP {X}%type_scope
Inductive BPCP (P : stack bool) : Prop := cBPCP : forall u : string bool, derivable P u u -> BPCP P
PCPX = fun (X : Type) (P : stack X) => exists A : list (card X), A <<= P /\ A <> [] /\ tau1 A = tau2 A : forall X : Type, stack X -> Prop Arguments PCPX {X}%type_scope
BPCP_ind : forall (P : stack bool) (P0 : Prop), (forall u : string bool, derivable P u u -> P0) -> BPCP P -> P0
BPCP_sind : forall (P : stack bool) (P0 : SProp), (forall u : string bool, derivable P u u -> P0) -> BPCP P -> P0
iPCPb = fun P : stack bool => exists A : list nat, (forall a, a el A -> a < | P |) /\ A <> [] /\ itau1 P A = itau2 P A : stack bool -> Prop
der_cons : forall (P0 : stack ?X) (x y : list ?X) (u v : string ?X), (x, y) el P0 -> derivable P0 u v -> derivable P0 (x ++ u) (y ++ v) where ?X : [P : stack nat R : stack nat |- Type]
Inductive derivable (X : Type) (P : stack X) : string X -> string X -> Prop := der_sing : forall x y : list X, (x, y) el P -> derivable P x y | der_cons : forall (x y : list X) (u v : string X), (x, y) el P -> derivable P u v -> derivable P (x ++ u) (y ++ v) Arguments derivable {X}%type_scope Arguments der_sing {X}%type_scope _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments der_cons {X}%type_scope _ (_ _)%list_scope
derivable_ind : forall (X : Type) (P : stack X) (P0 : string X -> string X -> Prop), (forall x y : list X, (x, y) el P -> P0 x y) -> (forall (x y : list X) (u v : string X), (x, y) el P -> derivable P u v -> P0 u v -> P0 (x ++ u) (y ++ v)) -> forall s s0 : string X, derivable P s s0 -> P0 s s0
derivable_sind : forall (X : Type) (P : stack X) (P0 : string X -> string X -> SProp), (forall x y : list X, (x, y) el P -> P0 x y) -> (forall (x y : list X) (u v : string X), (x, y) el P -> derivable P u v -> P0 u v -> P0 (x ++ u) (y ++ v)) -> forall s s0 : string X, derivable P s s0 -> P0 s s0
PCP = PCPX : stack nat -> Prop
Relation_Operators.Desc_ind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> Prop), P [] -> (forall x : A, P [x]) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ [y]) -> P (l ++ [y]) -> P ((l ++ [y]) ++ [x])) -> forall l : list A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA l -> P l
Relation_Operators.Desc_sind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> SProp), P [] -> (forall x : A, P [x]) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ [y]) -> P (l ++ [y]) -> P ((l ++ [y]) ++ [x])) -> forall l : list A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA l -> P l
der_sing : forall (P0 : stack ?X) (x y : list ?X), (x, y) el P0 -> derivable P0 x y where ?X : [P : stack nat R : stack nat |- Type]
existT : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Type) (x : A), P x -> {x : A & P x}
exist : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A), P x -> {x : A | P x}
Forall_cons : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Forall P l -> Forall P (x :: l)
Forall_nil : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop), Forall P []
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0 -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
list_rect : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Type), P [] -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : list A, P l
list_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P [] -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : list A, P l
